markdownRemark.html:
Hey! Here you can see the list of the books I've read so far and going to read in the future. I also wrote a review for some of them in Russian, so feel free to click on the titles of the books to read my reviews.

The book(-s) I'm currently reading

  • Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind - Yuval Noah Harrari
  • What It Takes: Lessons in the Pursuit of Excellence - Stephen A. Schwarzman

Books I've read in 2021

  1. The Godfather - Mario Puzo
  2. White Nights - Fyodor Dostoevsky
  3. Ignorance: How It Drives Science - Stuart Firestein
  4. When Breath Becomes Air - Paul Kalanithi
  5. The Gold-Bug and Other Short Stories - Edgar Allan Poe
  6. How the Steel Was Tempered - Nikolai Ostrovski
  7. A Thousand Brains: A New Theory of Intelligence - Jeff Hawkins
  8. The Brain: The Story of You - David Eagleman
  9. Behave: The Biology of Humans at Our Best and Worst - Robert M. Sapolsky
  10. Surely You're Joking, Mr. Feynman! - Richard Feynman

Books I read in 2020

  1. The Outsider - Stephen King
  2. Why We Sleep: Unlocking the Power of Sleep and Dreams - Matthew Walker
  3. The Metamorphosis - Franz Kafka
  4. Essentialism: The Disciplined Pursuit of Less - Greg McKeown
  5. The Idiot - ‎Fyodor Dostoevsky (Russian)
  6. Ego Is The Enemy - Ryan Holiday
  7. How to Win at College - Cal Newport
  8. Sleeping Beauties - Stephen King & Owen King
  9. It's Not About You: A Brief Guide to a Meaningful Life - Tom Rath
  10. The Brothers Karamazov (Russian) - Fyodor Dostoevsky
  11. The Book of Words (Russian) - Abai Kunanbaev
  12. 21 Lessons for the 21st Century - Yuval Noah Harrari
  13. The End of Eternity - Isaac Asimov
  14. If It Bleeds - Stephen King
  15. Make Your Home Among Strangers: A Novel - Jennine Crucet
  16. Man's Search For Meaning - Viktor E. Frankl
  17. Talking To Strangers - Malcolm Gladwell
  18. Outliers: The Story of Success - Malcolm Gladwell
  19. Stillness Is The Key - Ryan Holiday
  20. The Smallest Lights In The Universe - Sara Seager
  21. Fahrenheit 451 - Ray Bradbury
  22. Meditations - Marcus Aurelius

Books I read in 2019

  1. Homo Deus - Yuval Noah Harrari
  2. Educated - Tara Westover
  3. A Brief History of Time - Steven Hawking
  4. Bad Blood - John Carreyrou
  5. The Four - Scott Galloway
  6. Brief Answers to the Big Questions - Steven Hawking
  7. The Tattooist of Auschwitz - Heather Morris
  8. The Obstacle is the Way - Ryan Holiday
  9. Murder on the Orient Express - Agatha Christie
  10. An American Tragedy - Theodore Dreiser
  11. South of the Border, West of the Sun - Haruki Murakami
  12. Flowers for Algernon (Russian) - Daniel Keyes
  13. Factfulness: Ten reasons We're Wrong About the World and Why Things Are Better Than You Think - Hans Rosling
  14. The Institute - Stephen King

Books I read in 2018

  1. Zero to One - Blake Masters and Peter Thiel
  2. The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck - Mark Manson
  3. Everybody Lies: Big Data, New Data, and What the Internet Can Tell Us About Who We Really Are - Seth Stephens-Davidowitz
  4. The Great Gatsby - F.Scott Fitzgerald
  5. The Shawshank Redemption - Stephen King
  6. Crime and Punishment (Russian) - Fyodor Dostoyevsky
  7. Without a Dowry (Russian) - Aleksandr Ostrovsky
